message.content: This question requires basic knowledge of soil structure. Gopher homes, also known as burrows or tunnels created by gophers, can loosen the soil. Gophers dig tunnels underground, which helps to break up compacted soil and allows for better aeration and water drainage. Option (B) is incorrect because wind does not directly loosen soil, although it can erode loose or dry soil. Option (C) is incorrect because heat does not directly loosen soil. Option (D) is also incorrect because bird nests do not have a direct impact on soil loosening.

Heat and bird nests do not have direct effects on soil loosening.
